intro: Ruellia uribei, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to summer. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Ruellia uribei is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
